channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Data Spark Bigger Euro Reaction Than ECB Decision
item.description: The euro was little moved by the European Central Bank’s 25 basis-point interest-rate cut on Thursday but improved U.S. economic data sparked a bigger...

item.title: Morgan Stanley shares pop 7% after beating estimates for third-quarter profit and revenue
item.description: Morgan Stanley has several tail winds in its favor, from high stock values to a rebound in investment banking and strong trading activity.

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Fall Unexpectedly
item.description: U.S. crude oil inventories fell unexpectedly last week as refineries raised their capacity use and a decline in imports offset an increase in producti...

item.title: AI Honeymoon Is Over for Chip Equipment Industry
item.description: This week brought a reckoning as ASML’s disappointing results revealed an uneven market.

item.title: Nvidia and Apple supplier TSMC shares pop 10% after quarterly profit soars on AI demand
item.description: TSMC, the world’s largest producer of advanced chips, posted a 54% hike in third-quarter profit.

item.title: Gold Futures Rise to New Record on Sliding Treasury Yields, China Demand
item.description: Gold futures rise 0.5% to $2,705.10 a troy ounce, having peaked at a new record of $2,712.70 in late European trading.

item.title: Netflix earnings are after the bell. Here's what to expect
item.description: Netflix is due to report third-quarter earnings after the closing bell Thursday.

item.title: ASML just gave us a first glimpse into how U.S. chip export curbs will dent its China sales
item.description: ASML on Tuesday offered the first glimpse into how U.S. restrictions on exports of its advanced chip manufacturing tools to China will impact its sale...

item.title: Here's a rapid-fire update on all 33 portfolio stocks, including our 2 newest positions
item.description: Jim Cramer broke down each holding Wednesday during the October Monthly Meeting.

item.title: A Wyoming Couple Are Tired of Being Landlords. They Need a New Financial Plan.
item.description: Amy Nagler and Ranie Lynds own seven homes worth nearly $2 million. A financial adviser offers some suggestions for diversifying.
